messages.subject: RE: [samuraihistory] edo period letterfold
messages.msgSnippet: how to close?use boiled rice(or potatoes in europe..)it works as glue... To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com From: kenji@sekiguchi.us Date: Sun, 31 May 2009
messages.messageBody:
how to close?use boiled rice(or potatoes in europe..)it works as glue...



To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
From: kenji@...
Date: Sun, 31 May 2009 21:09:16 +0700
Subject: [samuraihistory] edo period letterfold







Hi, I am looking for the guide on how to fold formal letter, written with
brush, in edo period. I see on movies sometimes they also use self-made
envelope without glue, so I also want to know how to fold this envelope, and
what to write on it, the sender and the recipient names or just the
recipient name? etc..

Any help would be highly appreciated.

Regards,

Kenji Sekiguchi (関口剣志)

http://www.samurai.or.id

http://www.kenjishodokai.com

http://www.nukitsuke.com

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]









_________________________________________________________________
Tutustu videoiden avulla Windows Live tuotteisiin.
http://www.microsoft.fi/live

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
